note.p: Death: His seat at Bedgebury Park, Cranbook, Kent (20 October 1887)
Education: Harrow School; Trinity College, Cambridge. BA (1841), MA (1844), DCL (1848)

Career: MP for Maidstone, Kent (1841-1852); MP for Cambridge University (1868-1887); paid for All Saints Church, Margaret Street, London to be built; co-founded the 'Saturday Review' (1855); Privy Councillor (1880)
